newsitem.title: USA: Osmotics pegs wrinkle market at $800 million.
newsitem.headline: Osmotics pegs wrinkle market at $800 million.

text.p: Osmotics Corp sees a potential $800 million market niche developing in the cosmetics industry for skin patches designed to minimize wrinkles, president Steven Porter told a meeting of investment analysts on Wednesday.

Denver-based Osmotics, which expects to go public within the next six weeks via a 1,125,000 share offering, reported a strong retail demand for the company's line of such transdermal cosmetic skin care products.

The company's Antioxidant Skin Care Derms are sold as patches which, applied to the skin, deliver a dose of Vitamin C that is designed to reduce the appearance of fine facial lines. The patches account for about 80 percent of Osmotics' revenues, which totaled $1.3 million in 1996.
Porter said his company, which is seeking U.S. patent approval on its patch as a method of delivering antioxidants, is in talks with two large cosmetic companies on licensing possibilities.
Though its products are used primarily for crow's feet, upper lip lines and brow furrows, Osmotics eventually plans to introduce a variety of new patch shapes.
Osmotics has applied for listing on the Nasdaq SmallCap Market under the "OSMO" symbol. National Securities Corp is the underwriter for the pulbic offering.
